Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'human aging' to someone reading at the Middle School level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 50 words that follows your plan. Read your work. Make revisions as needed.
Human aging is a process that affects everyone. As we get older, our bodies change in different ways. Our skin gets wrinkly, our muscles get weaker, and our eyesight and hearing may decline. This happens because our cells get older and less able to work properly. It's a natural part of life.
Step 4: Determine the main idea of your paragraph.
The main idea is that human aging is a natural process that affects our bodies in different ways as we get older.
Step 5: Identify the supporting details in your paragraph.
The supporting details are:
- Our skin gets wrinkly
- Our muscles get weaker
- Our eyesight and hearing may decline
- Our cells get older and less able to work properly
Step 6: Explain why these details support the main idea.
These details support the main idea because they explain how human aging affects the human body. They describe the physical changes that occur as people get older.
